| Chemical |
| --- |
| third-generation OCs |
| second-generation OCs |

Explanation:

* "third-generation OCs" and "second-generation OCs" are the only entities that can be considered chemical entities in this paragraph.
* They are abbreviations for "third-generation oral contraceptives" and "second-generation oral contraceptives" respectively.
* Oral contraceptives are hormonal medications that contain synthetic forms of the hormones estrogen and progestin, which are chemicals.
* Therefore, "third-generation OCs" and "second-generation OCs" can be considered chemical entities.
